english: hand holding a hammer or a mallet

etymology.description: Depicts a hand holding a tool (hammer/mallet)
etymology.interpretation: The character 殳 represents a hand gripping a mallet or hammer, illustrating the form and function of the object.

examples.chinese: 古代战士握紧殳(殳)，冲向敌阵(衝向敵陣)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài zhànshì wò jǐn shū, chōng xiàng dí zhèn.
examples.english: Ancient warriors gripped their mallets, charging toward the enemy formation.

examples.chinese: 工匠拿着殳(殳)，敲打铁砧(鐵砧)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngjiàng ná zhe shū, qiāo dǎ tiě zhēn.
examples.english: The artisan held the mallet, striking the iron anvil.

examples.chinese: 修理工举起殳(殳)，敲打破损钟表(敲打破損鐘錶)。
examples.pinyin: Xiūlǐgōng jǔ qǐ shū, qiāo dǎ pò sǔn zhōngbiǎo.
examples.english: The repairman raised the mallet, tapping the broken clock.
